goals__remit:
The "GAL Tecuci" Association is a public-private partnership  with the consensus of the 68 public and private partners to engage and contribute to the balanced and sustainable development of the LAG through the implementation of the LEADER program, the NRDP 2014-2020. 
Our goals are involving the following activities: 
Lobbies to influence policymaking, policy implementation and EU instututions decision-making process, such as CLLD european concept. 
 
 Our   general and main goal is to involve and participate by lobbies in the field of Rural Development policy framework and the CAP. 
 
 Our interest is to take part in EU structures such us Expert Gropus, Commitees or forums in the filed of the EU’s Rural Development policy that supports rural areas to meet the wide range of economic, environmental and social challenges of the 21st century. It aims to achieve the following strategic objectives: 
fostering the competitiveness of agriculture; 
ensuring the sustainable management of natural resources, and climate action; 
achieving a balanced territorial development of rural economies and communities, including the creation and maintenance of employment. 
 We are providing written or oral positions in public consultations, public hearings or debates held by the EU institutions, 
 We are interested to organise events or forums dealing with EU policies, to propose drafts, circulates and communicates interest-related information material or discussion/position papers dealing with EU policies, such us:  
implementation of the bottom-up approach of LEADER  
Preserving the innovative/experimental character of LEADER 
Implementation of the “cooperation measure” in LEADER 
Better Local Development Strategies
relevant_communication:
We have participated with oral proposals for the elaboration of the Tartu Declaration: Renewing LEADER/CLLD for 2020+ " from European Leader Association for Rural Development. 
On , the ELARD conference 22 and 23 November 2016 “Renewing LEADER/CLLD for 2020+; Celebrating 
25 years of LEADER in Europe!” Tartu, Estonia.  
At this conference, the 140 delegates from 25 European countries representing about 2000 LEADER Local 
Action Groups of Europe, rural networks, managing authorities and the European Commission, developed 
the for the year 2027 as regards the role of LEADER/CLLD (community-led local following vision 
development) and local action groups: We urge the European Commission, other European institutions and Member States to engage all their 
efforts in a renewal of the framework for LEADER/CLLD when reforming the framework for the ESI Funds for 
the programming period 2021-2027. 
The Declaration was composed using participatory methods during two days of conference workshops. 
Participants were from Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, 
France, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, 
Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden and United Kingdom.
